column1: This file will be used to upload data to the NelsonDB. FIELD NAMES CAN BE ADDED, BUT SHOULD BE DONE SPARINGLY

column4: Definition
The row ID of the row being measured. The Row ID is a unique ID in the format 08PN0023. Leave blank if not applicable.
The plant ID of the plant being measured. The Plant ID is a unique ID in the format 08PN0023_001. Leave blank if not applicable.
The environment ID of the environment being measured. The Env ID is a unique ID. Leave blank if not applicable.
The sample ID of the sample being measured. The Sample ID is a unique ID. Leave blank if not applicable.
The microbe ID of the microbe being measured. The Microbe ID is a unique ID. Leave blank if not applicable.
The well ID of the well being measured. The Well ID is a unique ID. Leave blank if not applicable.
The plate ID of the plate being measured. The Plate ID is a unique ID. Leave blank if not applicable.
The DNA ID of the dna being measured. The DNA ID is a unique ID. Leave blank if not applicable.
The tissue ID of the tissue being measured. The Tissue ID is a unique ID. Leave blank if not applicable.
The extract ID of the extract being measured. The Extract ID is a unique ID. Leave blank if not applicable.
The culture ID of the culture being measured. The Culture ID is a unique ID. Leave blank if not applicable.
The parameter being measured. The measurement paraemter is unique.
The username of the user taking the measurement. Example: firstname_lastname
The datetime when the measuremnt was taken. Format: 2015-01-30 14:50
The actual result or value of the measurement.
Any additional comments about the measurement.

column2: For recording the parameter being measured.

column4: Definition
A unique name for the parameter being measured. Example: afl.afl, nlb.ds1, dys.ath, 1K CO2, 5K CO2. MSUT BE UNIQUE
A descriptor for the type of measurement being done. Example: Respiration, Toxin, Row, Plant, Environmental
A detailed description for how the measurement is taken, include the model of any instrument used.
The unit that is relevant to the measurement. Example: g, kg, ppm, ml
A unique ID that is used by the Buckler Lab. Leave blank if not applicable.
